Title: Oxymoron
References: ŠTULAJTEROVÁ, A., JESENSKÁ, P.: English Stylistics. 1. vyd. Banská Bystrica : Univerzita Mateja Bela, 2013. 114 s.
Content:
Oxymoron is a figure of speech in which two opposite ideas are joined to create an effect. 

It is based on antonymy (opposite), a combination of two words whose meanings clash, being opposites in a sense. The common oxymoron phrase phrase is a combination of an adjective proceeded by a noun with contrasting meanings.

examples:

  • living death
  • awfully pretty
  • seriously funny
